alert.note: Alert for Bourbon (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued February 16 at 10:06PM EST until February 17 at 10:00PM EST by NWS Louisville
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Kentucky... Stoner Creek at Paris affecting Bourbon County. .Heavy rain from the past twenty four hours will cause the river to rise. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE TOMORROW EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Stoner Creek at Paris. * WHEN...Until late tomorrow evening. * IMPACTS...At 18.0 feet, Water floods a few low roads on right bank of creek. At 20.0 feet, Water enters yards of homes downstream of water plant. Parts of the Garrard Park flood. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 2:15 PM EST Thursday the stage was 16.6 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage late this afternoon to a crest of 19.8 feet late this evening. It will then fall below flood stage tomorrow afternoon. - Flood stage is 18.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 19.8 feet on 06/30/1998. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Stay tuned to NOAA Weather Radio and your local media for the latest information. If you are affected by these crests take any necessary actions. Additional information is available at water.weather.gov/ahps2/index. php?wfo=lmk Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/lmk. The next statement will be issued late Friday morning.
